title: Oscars 2017 - Which films are nominated, what time is it on UK TV, who will be the host? Everything you need to know
text:
La La Land, Arrival, Hacksaw Ridge Share Get What's On   Thank you for subscribing!   
The nominations are in, and to no-one’s great surprise there are a fistful of potential Academy Awards for La La Land. 
The musical set in Los Angeles, directed by Damien Chazelle (who also helmed the Oscar nominated Whiplash) has equaled the record for most Oscar nominations with a massive 14 nods. 
These include Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actor (Ryan Gosling), Best Actress (Emma Stone) and many more. 
Hollywood loves films about Hollywood as films like The Artist and Birdman have proved over the past several years. So perhaps it should be no surprise that La La Land is such a hot favourite going into this. 
As always there is the usual chatter about who’s been snubbed this year and the lack of Amy Adams’ name in the Best Actress category for her performance in Arrival seems a little unjust. 
Denis Villeneuve’s sci-fi slowburner however is nominated for Best Picture, Best Adapted Screenplay, Best Cinematography among others. 
So whatever you think should win, here is everything you need to know on how to find out. Ryan Gosling When are the Oscars 2017? 
The 89th annual Academy Awards take place Sunday, 26th February at the Dolby Theatre at the Hollywood and Highland Center in Los Angeles, Angeles. What time are the Oscars 2017? 
All the red carpet action kicks off from midnight in the UK GMT (which is 7pm in New York and 4pm in LA.) The actual ceremony is slated to begin at 1.30am in the UK (which is 8.30pm in New York and 5.30pm in LA.) 
The Oscar presentation also will be televised live in more than 225 countries and territories worldwide. Where can I watch the Oscars 2017 in the UK? 
You can watch the Oscars on Sky Cinema special Sky Cinema’s Oscars channel - but be prepared for a late night! Now TV will also stream the ceremony. Hillary Vlinton and Jimmy Kimmel (Photo: Photo by Justin Sullivan/Getty Images) Read More Bluedot Festival adds more acts to 2017 line up - plus WIN TICKETS Who is hosting the Oscars 2017? 
Not Jimmy Fallon, the other one - Jimmy Kimmel. Kimmel is the long-time host of popular late night talk show Jimmy Kimmel Live! in the US. It’s the first time he’s hosted the Academy Awards, although he’s got a wealth of experience having presented the Emmys, ESPY Awards and American Music Awards in the past. He’s also presented ABC’s post-Oscar shows in recent years. Is the Oscar trophy made from real gold? 
The Oscar is 13 and a half inches high and weighs eight and a half pounds. It’s made from solid bronze and plated in 24-carat gold. The only exception to this was during World War II, when the gongs were made from painted plaster for three years. After the war, winners were able to swap the plaster statues for gold-plated ones. 
The iconic statue was designed by Cedric Gibbons, who was the chief art director at MGM. It was then up to LA sculptor George Stanley to make the 3D reality. 
It takes three months to make 50 statues. (Photo: Photo by Christopher Polk/Getty Images) Who do you want to win? 
So, do you agree with the tidal wave of love that has hit La La Land or do you think Moonlight or Fences deserve the Best Picture gong?

Ryan Gosling was previously nominated for an Academy Award in 2006 for his performance in Half Nelson. Not only has Denzel Washington earned himself another Best Actor nomination for his role in Fences, he also directed the movie.
